title: Plastic straws: Government confirms ban in England - BBC
body: The government has announced a ban on plastic straws, drinks stirrers, and plastic cotton buds in England from 2020, after a public consultation found over 80% of people supported it. The ban will not apply to people with medical needs or disabilities, and will allow registered pharmacies to sell plastic straws over the counter or online.
readable_content: -User (2023-12-08): I read an article about the UK government's decision to ban plastic straws, drinks stirrers, and plastic cotton buds from 2020 in England. The ban comes after over 80% of people supported it in a public consultation. It's good to see steps being taken to reduce plastic waste and its impact on the environment.
summary:
The sentiment of the post is positive, expressing support for the UK government's decision to ban plastic straws, drinks stirrers, and plastic cotton buds. The user believes it is a good step to reduce plastic waste and its impact on the environment.
